hedline.hl1: F.T.C. SUES WEB SITES OVER BILLING

abstract.p: Federal Trade Commission and New York State attorney general, Eliot Spitzer, sue owners and operators of network of sex-oriented Web sites, including www.playgirl.com and www.highsociety.com, asserting they illegally billed thousands of people for services that were advertised as free and that they charged many others who never visited Web sites at all; suit contends Crescent Publishing Group, along with 64 affiliated companies, routinely charged people who provide credit card information obstensibly required to verify they were over 18 before they could view sites (S)

block.p: The Federal Trade Commission and the New York attorney general have sued the owners and operators of a network of sex-oriented Web sites, including www.playgirl.com and www.highsociety.com, asserting they illegally billed thousands of people for services that were advertised as free, and for charging many others who never visited the Web sites at all. The suit, filed in Federal District Court in Manhattan, contends that Crescent Publishing Group of New York, along with 64 affiliated corporations, routinely charge people who provide credit card information ostensibly required to verify they were over 18 before they could view the sex sites. Telephone calls to Crescent Publishing, and its owner, Bruce Chew, and principal, David Bernstein, were not returned yesterday.
